maml:description.maml:para: Connect-SL1 prepares a connection to ScienceLogic's SL1 environment.
Use this function to prepare your powershell session to connect to ScienceLogic's SL1. This only needs to be called once every session.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the base url of the SL1 environment
A username and password required to connect to SL1.
Returns a connection status result by performing a test call.
Enter the base url of the SL1 environment
A username and password required to connect to SL1.
Returns a connection status result by performing a test call.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SL1Credential = Get-Credential Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential $SL1Credential
The first command registers a credential. The second command creates a connection to ScienceLogic and saves it in memory for subsequent calls to the environment.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an appliance from the Sciencelogic SL1 environment.
This function gets an appliance from the SL1 environment that can be used to create a discovery via API.

maml:Description.maml:para: A SL1 filter that can be used to get multiple appliances.
The amount of appliances to return. If this is not specified, the default of 50 is used.
The ID of an appliance.
The amount of appliances to return. If this is not specified, the default of 50 is used.
A SL1 filter that can be used to get multiple appliances.
The ID of an appliance.
The amount of appliances to return. If this is not specified, the default of 50 is used.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential ( Get-Credential ) PS C:\>Get-SL1Appliance -ID 1
The first command establishes a connection to a Sciencelogic platform. The second command retrieves an appliance with ID 1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a collector group from the Sciencelogic SL1 environment.
This function gets a collector group from the SL1 environment that can be used to create a discovery via API.

maml:Description.maml:para: A SL1 filter that can be used to get multiple collector groups.
The amount of collector groups to return. If this is not specified, the default of 50 is used.
The ID of a collector group
The amount of collector groups to return. If this is not specified, the default of 50 is used.
A SL1 filter that can be used to get multiple collector groups.
The ID of a collector group
The amount of collector groups to return. If this is not specified, the default of 50 is used.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential ( Get-Credential ) PS C:\>Get-SL1CollectorGroup -ID 1
The first command establishes a connection to a Sciencelogic platform. The second command retrieves collector group with ID 1

maml:description.maml:para: Get-SL1Credential gets a ScienceLogic SL1 Credential via REST API.
This function gets the ScienceLogic SL1 credentials that are accessible via the API. Possible credential types are SNMP, DB, SOAP, LDAP, BASIC, SSH and PowerShell.

maml:Description.maml:para: Defines the type of credential that should be fetched.
Gets a couple of credentials, based on an SL1 Filter
Defines the number of credentials that should be retrieved.
Defines the type of credential that should be fetched.
Gets an SL1 Credential, based on an ID
Defines the number of credentials that should be retrieved.
Gets a couple of credentials, based on an SL1 Filter
Gets an SL1 Credential, based on an ID
Defines the number of credentials that should be retrieved.
Defines the type of credential that should be fetched.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential (Get-Credential) PS C:\> Get-SL1Credential -Type SNMP -Id 1
The first command creates a connection to the ScienceLogic SL1 Platform. The second command retrieves SL1 Credential with ID 1 and type SNMP.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a device in ScienceLogic by ID
The Get-SL1Device cmdlet gets a device in the ScienceLogic platform, referenced by the device ID.

maml:Description.maml:para: An integer defining the ID of the ScienceLogic Device
A Sciencelogic filter used to get a set of devices
The amount of devices that need to be get in each batch.
An integer defining the ID of the ScienceLogic Device
A Sciencelogic filter used to get a set of devices
The amount of devices that need to be get in each batch.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential ( Get-Credential ) PS C:\>Get-SL1Device -ID 1
The first command connects to the ScienceLogic platform. The second command gets device with ID 1

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential ( Get-Credential ) PS C:\>Get-SL1Device -Filter 'filter.0.organization.eq=15'
The first command connects to the ScienceLogic platform. The second command gets all devices for organization with id 15, with a limit of 100 (default).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential (Get-Credential ) PS C:\>Get-SL1Device
The first command connect to the ScienceLogic platform. The second command get the first 100 devices.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a device group from the sciencelogic sl1 platform.
This function gets a device group by ID or by a query.

maml:Description.maml:para: SL1 Filter that can be used to find a device group
Specifies the amount of device groups to be returned.
The ID of the device group
Specifies the amount of device groups to be returned.
SL1 Filter that can be used to find a device group
The ID of the device group
Specifies the amount of device groups to be returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential ( Get-Credential ) PS C:\>Get-SL1DeviceGroup -ID 1
The first command established a connection to a Sciencelogic Platform. The second command retrieves a device group with id 1.

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-SL1Organization cmdlet gets organizations in the ScienceLogic platform, referenced by the organization ID or by a filter.

maml:Description.maml:para: An integer defining the ID of the ScienceLogic Organization
A Sciencelogic filter used to get a set of organizations
The amount of organizations that need to be get in each batch.
An integer defining the ID of the ScienceLogic Organization
A Sciencelogic filter used to get a set of organizations
The amount of organizations that need to be get in each batch.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command connects to the ScienceLogic platform. The second command gets the organization with ID 1
The first command connects to the ScienceLogic platform. The second command gets the organization with a billing id like B-1967354

maml:description.maml:para: This function gets a ScienceLogic SL1 Template via the REST API.

maml:Description.maml:para: The filter can be used to return several templates, based on an SL1 Filter
Limits the number of templates to be returned.
The ID parameter ensures only a single template can be returned.
Limits the number of templates to be returned.
The filter can be used to return several templates, based on an SL1 Filter
The ID parameter ensures only a single template can be returned.
Limits the number of templates to be returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Connect-SL1 -URI 'https://support.sciencelogic.com' -Credential (Get-Credential) PS C:\> Get-SL1Template -Id 1
The first command creates a connection to the ScienceLogic SL1 Environment. The second command gets the template with id 1
